traits.name: Plant Camouflage
entries: The treefolk has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks it makes in forest terrain.

traits.name: Tree Stride
entries: Once on each of its turns, the treefolk can use 10 feet of its movement to step magically into one living tree within 5 feet of itself and emerge from a second living tree within 60 feet of itself that it can see, appearing in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the second tree. Both trees must be at least as large as the treefolk.

actions.name: Multiattack
entries: The treefolk makes two Crushing Vine attacks, two Nightshade Bolt attacks, or one of each.

actions.name: Crushing Vine
entries: Melee atk +10 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 25 (3d12 + 6 damage) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it has the {@condition grappled} condition (escape DC 18). While {@condition grappled}, the creature also has the {@condition restrained} condition. The treefolk can grapple up to six creatures this way.

actions.name: Nightshade Bolt
entries: Ranged Spell atk +9 to hit, range 60 ft., one target. 33 (6d10 damage) poison damage.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The treefolk casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 17}):
